title: Bill McMullen Adidas Adicolor New York City logo
content:
![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317061519im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Adicolor%20New%20York%20City_6718.jpg)

People

Does anybody know this Bill McMullen Adidas Adicolor New York City logo font?

I did a quick trace on Illustrator and the original logo can be found here: [http://www.billmcmullen.com/adidas.NYC.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317061519/http:/www.billmcmullen.com/adidas.NYC.html "http://www.billmcmullen.com/adidas.NYC.html")

I will donate a kidney to the person who solves this!

Christaki

Font: 

 Geodezyx NF 

Solved By: 

 [Ryuk](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317061519/http:/typophile.com/user/22675 "View user profile.")

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [Adicolor New York City.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317061519/http:/typophile.com/files/Adicolor%20New%20York%20City.jpg) | 11.94 KB |
author: Christaki1

comments.content: Very late but I think [Geodezyx NF](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317061519/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/nicksfonts/geodezyx-nf) should do the job quite easily.
Thanks a lot guys. That's one kidney each!

I note that D730-Deco-Regular is by SoftMaker Software GmbH , a notorious font pirate IIRC.  
I have no problem with the legitimacy of the Nick Curtis font.  
Don
